2005T002-d-01-31-05-BB.Contributing Accident Cause: Kicking or dropping cars, inadequate precautions
2005T002-d-01-31-05-BB.Narrative: H79931 WAS WORKING KLOCKNER INDUSTRIES.  8 CARS OF THE TRAIN WERE LEFT ON THE MAIN WEST OF THE KLOCKNER SPUR.  AN EMPTY CAR WAS SWITCHED OUT OF THE INDUSTRY AND COUPLED TO THE 8 ON THE MAIN.  THE POWER WENT TO THE GORDONSVILLE SIDING, WEST END AND RECEIVED DISPATCHER PERMISSION TO PUT THE POWER-OPERATED SWITCH INTO HAND OPERATION.  THE CREW PULLED 3 LOADED CARS OUT ON THE MAIN AND PLACED THEM EASTOF THE SWITCH.  THE CREW TESTED THE HAND BRAKES ON THESE CARS WHILE ON THE MAIN.  THEN THE LOCOMOTIVE WAS PLACED INTO THE SIDING AND THE SWITCH LINED FOR THE MAIN.  THE CONDUCTOR, ON THE LEAD CAR, ALLOWED THE CARS TO DRIFT WEST OF THE SIDING SWITCH AND DRAW THE HAND BRAKE TO STOP THE MOTION (THIS ALLOWS THE LOCOMOTIVE TO LINE UP PROPERLY FOR SHOVING CARS INTO THE INDUSTRY).  WHEN THE CONDUCTOR TRIED TO STOP THE CUT, THE FIRST CAR`S (ACFX 58651) HAND BRAKE DID NOT HOLD THE CUT.  THE CONDUCTOR WAS WORKING ON THE SECOND CAR`S HAND BRAKE WHEN HE SAW THAT THE CUT WAS MOVING VERY CLOSE TO THE STANDING CUT ON THE MAIN TRACK.  HE EGRESSED BEFORE THE THREE LOADED CARS IMPACTED THE LEAD EMPTY CAR ONTHE STANDING CUT.  THE IMPACT CAUSED THE CAR (FPAX 980059) TO BUCKLE.  THE BUCKLE IN THE CAR BODY CAUSED THE BODY TO EXCEED RULE 62 (AAR FIELD MANUAL OF INTERCHANGE RULES, 2005) SPECIFICATIONS OF 5/16" CLEARANCE ON THE TRUCK SIDE BEARINGS (B-END OF THE CAR).  THERE WERE NO INJURIES.

000009884-d-01-31-05-CSX.Narrative: THE CAUSE CODE OF T299 (OTHER RAIL & JOINT BAR FAILURES) WAS APPLIED TO THIS ACCIDENT BASED ON THE LOCAL TAP TEAMS MAJORITY OPINION EVEN THOUGH THE PRINCIPLE RAIL WAS NEVER FOUND. THERE WAS A SUSPECTRAIL THAT WAS SENT TO THE METALLURGIST LAB THAT CAME BACK NEGATIVE (SEE REPORT: POPES CREEK REPORT ATTACHED). THE MAJORITY CAUSE WAS APPLIED BASED ON THIS BEING THE MOST PROBABLE CAUSE. THE MAJORITY IN THIS CASE BEING TRANSPORTATION & MECHANICAL. ENGINEERING BEING THE MINORITY NEVER SUBMITTED A MINORITY REPORT EXPLAINING THEIR POSITION OR WHAT THEY FELT CAUSED THE INCIDENT. THIS IS IN COMPLIANCE WITH THE CSXT BP-1009 THAT OUTLINES THE ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES OF TRAIN ACCIDENT ANALYSIS AND PREVENTION.

I551605-d-01-06-05-LRWN.Primary Accident Cause: Buffing or slack action excessive, train handling
I551605-d-01-06-05-LRWN.Accident Cause: Buffing or slack action excessive, train handling
I551605-d-01-06-05-LRWN.Narrative: TRAIN WAS MOVING WEST AT APPROXIMATELY 10 MPH WHEN LEAD WHEEL OF MP 716820 WENT OVER RAIL AT END OFCURVE.  MP 716820 TRAVELED APPROXIMATELY 4 1/2 CAR LENGTHS AND TURNED OVER.  IN THE PROCESS IT TURNED OVER THE CAR IMMEDIATELY AHEAD OF IT AS WELL AS THE TWO CARS IMMEDIATELY TRAILING IT.  THE REAR CAR THAT TURNED OVER BROKE LOOSE FROM THE TRAIN AND WHILE THE NEXT TWO CARS DERAILED, THEY REMAINED UPRIGHT.  ALL FOURTEEN CARS IN THE TRAIN CONTAINED GRAIN.  THERE WAS NOTHING UNUSUAL IN THE TRACK CONDITION OR ALIGNMENT THAT WOULD HAVE CONTRIBUTED TO THIS DERAILMENT.  THE ENGINEER ACKNOWLEDGED THAT THE SLACK PROBABLY CAME IN ON HIM.  AFTER A FULL INVESTIGATION OF THIS MATTER, WE CONCLUDE THIS WAS THE CAUSE OF THE DERAILMENT.

I0105-d-01-13-05-PATH.Accident Cause: Failure to stop train in clear
I0105-d-01-13-05-PATH.Narrative: A SWITCHING ENGINEER WAS ASSIGNED TO LAY UP A LIGHT TRAIN ON TAIL TRACK IN NEWARK SOUTH STREET YARD.THE CARS IN CONSIST WERE 748-619-610-854-742-124-611.  AFTER LEAVING PLATFORM H, SWITCHING ENGINEER STATES HE HAD BRAKES APPROACHING SIGNAL L12X, BEFORE ENTERING TAIL TRACK.  AT ONE CAR LENGTH FROMTHE BLOCK HE APPLIED THE BRAKES AND THE TRAIN NEITHER SLOWED OR STOPPED UNTIL STRIKING THE BLOCK.  THE FRONT TWO WHEELS OF THE FRONT TRUCK OF CAR 748 DERAILED.  THE TRACK BENT AS A RESULT OF IMPACT AND THE LEFT HAND RAIL HAS BEEN BROKEN.  THE BUMPING BLOCK AND THE CAR EQUIPMENT SUSTAINED MINOR DAMAGE.  THE EQUIPMENT WAS A LIGHT TRAIN FROM HARRISON YARD.  THE CONDUCTOR AND ENGINEER WHO BROUGHT THECONSIST TO NEWARK REPORTS THAT ALL BRAKE TEST WERE PERFORMED BEFORE LEAVING THE YARD.  EXAMINATION OF THE EQUIPMENT INDICATE BRAKES WERE OPERATING AS DESIGNED.  THE SWITCHING ENGINEER WAS TAKEN TO MEDICAL FOR DRUG & ALCOHOL TESTING.  DAMAGE WAS $7500.

D530205-d-01-16-05-SLWC.Primary Accident Cause: Other rail and joint bar defects (Provide detailed description in narrative)
D530205-d-01-16-05-SLWC.Accident Cause: Other rail and joint bar defects (Provide detailed description in narrative)
D530205-d-01-16-05-SLWC.Narrative: CREW WAS WESTBOUND ON SOONER SUB. WHEN CROSSING BRIDGE AT MP 464.2, CREW STATED THAT BRIDGE LOOKED NORMAL. UPON CROSSING BRIDGE, CREW STATED THAT SOMETHING DID NOT FEEL RIGHT AND IMMEDIATELY BEGAN TOSTOP THE TRAIN CONSISTENT WITH PROPER TRAIN HANDLING RULES AND INVESTIGATE BRIDGE FOR POSSIBLE DEFECTS. SOON AFTER THE ENGINEER SET THE AIR BRAKES TO STOP, THE TRAIN EXPERIENCED AN EMERGENCY APPLICATION. AFTER TRAIN CAME TO A COMPLETE STOP, THE CONDUCTOR BEGAN HIS INVESTIGATION INTO THE CAUSE OF THEEMERGENCY APPLICATION. THE CONDUCTOR WALKED BACK APPROXIMATELY 20 CAR LENGTHS AND NOTICED THAT TWOCARS HAD DERAILED AND THAT THE REAR PORTION OF THE TRAIN WAS NOW UNCOUPLED. THE CONDUCTOR NOW CONTINUED HIS INVESTIGATION FOR THE REAR PORTION. APPROXIMATELY 150 FEET EAST OF THE LEAD PORTION OF THE TRAIN, THE CONDUCTOR DISCOVERED THAT 6 CARS HAD DERAILED AND DESTROYED THE BRIDGE. AT THIS TIME THE CONDUCTOR CALLED FOR THE ENGINEER TO CONTACT THE DISPATCHER AND RELAY HIS FINDINGS. THE RAIL ON THE SOUTH SIDE AT THE EAST END OF THE BRIDGE BROKE AS THE TRAIN WAS TRAVELING OVER IT.  CLEAN BREAK NO DEFECTS SHOWING.

THE LEAD CAR DERAILED CAUSING THE EMERGENCY APPLICATIONOF THE BRAKES.  THEY DERAILED 13 CARS IN ALL.  THERE WAS A FLASH FLOOD IN THIS AREA.  THE TRAIN CREW WAS UNAWARE OF IT.

2005010301-d-01-06-05-ECBR.Narrative: On January 6, 2005 ECBR job 2000 was enroute to state junction.  Upon entering state junction yard limits the engineer noticed the end of train device of CSX F766 on the main line fouling the south ladder.  The engineer went into emergency in an attempt to stop from colliding with the rear of F766.ECBR locomotive 2003 collided with the rear of F766 resulting in substantial damage to locomotive 2003.  CSX F766 HAD BEEN LEFT DEAD AND UNMANNED ON THE MAIN LINE IN THE STATE JUNCTION YARD.

D04011405-d-01-14-05-FEC.Narrative: YARD CREW, WHILE IN THE PROCESS OF SHOVING CARS INTO OLD YARD #8, COUPLED TO CARS IN THAT TRACK.  JOINT DID NOT MAKE AND THE CUT OF CARS RAN THROUGH OLD YARD #7 SWITCH.  CARS WERE THEN COUPLED TOGETHER AND CAR ETTX 908658 ON THE NORTH END OF THIS CUT DERAILED WHEN CUT PROCEEDED BACK SOUTH.  WHEN PROCEEDING SOUTH WITH THIS CUT, DERAILED CAR, ETTX 908658, STRUCK FEC 19001 WHICH WAS IN OLD YARD #7.DERAILED CAR, ETTX 908658, RERAILED ITSELF ON THE SOUTH END OF OLD YARD #8 SWITCH.  NO PERSONAL INJURIES WERE SUSTAINED.

2005014-d-01-13-05-ICE.Narrative: 823 CREW KICKED A CAR DOWN THE LEAD.  THE CAR WAS ROLLING SLOW BUT CLEARED 1 TRACK.  THEY LINED THESWITCH FOR 1 AND PROCEEDED TO SHOVE CARS INTO 1.  THEY WERE WATCHING THE CAR ON THE LEAD, BUT DID NOT REALIZE THAT IT HAD STARTED TO ROLL BACK.  ONCE THEY SAW IT ROLLING BACK, THEY STOPPED THE SHOVE INTO 1 TRACK.  THE MSRC CAR THAT WAS ON THE LEAD ROLLED INTO THE CORNER OF SLGG 30093 THAT WAS THE SOUTH CAR HEADED INTO 1.

2005019-d-01-18-05-ICE.Narrative: TRAIN STOPPED AT SOUTH END OF BNSF DIAMOND AND ADDED HELPER ENGINE TO REAR OF TRAIN.  PULLED APPROXIMATELY 12 CAR LENGTHS AND DERAILED HS 61328 ON DIAMOND AND WHEN CAR CROSSED DERAIL SWITCH THE DERAILED CAR HAD THE TRUCK AND ONE PAIR OF WHEELS COME OUT FROM UNDERNEATH THE CAR TO THE WEST CLEAR OF THE MAIN TRACK.  TRAIN CONTINUED UP RUTLEDGE HILL WITH ONE PAIR OF WHEELS FROM THE HS 61328 AGAINST THE NEXT CAR CP 214532 UNTIL THE POWER SWITCH AT SOUTH OF RUTLEDGE AND THEN DERAILED THE CP 214532 CONTINUING APPROXIMATELY 10 CAR LENGTHS UNTIL THE TRAIN WENT INTO EMERGENCY.
